Issues.Title: Update UITypeEditors to use modern FolderBrowserDialog instead of XP version
Issues.Body:
During review of PR #2305 it was [noted](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2305#issuecomment-551158274)

> We should file a follow up issue that changes the folder picker to the newer one that Oren enabled way back when we first went open source.

The default folder dialog is from pre-Vista era, you have to opt-in to the modern version, which the code does not do (and there is no way for the user to override it either). Since the modern dialog will always be available under the supported operating systems it makes sense to always use it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Update UITypeEditors to use modern FolderBrowserDialog instead of XP version" (#2417)

Issues.Title: UITypeEditor does not type-forward from System.Drawing.Design
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0 master
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
For some reason UITypeEditor does not automatically type-forward from System.Drawing.Design to System.Windows.Forms.Design even though it is a public type. I was under the impression that public types get their type forwards automatically generated and manual entries only are required for internal types referenced by name.

This breaks [ControlBindingsCollection](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ControlBindingsCollection.cs#L15) which has an EditorAttribute referencing UITypeEditor itself. Technically this attribute is pretty much a no-op, its only effect is that a non-null editor is returned from TypeDescriptor.GetEditor but the editor itself has all methods no-op.

Either case I think the type forward for UITypeEditor should be put in place anyways, not just for attributes referencing by string but for general compatibility, since its a public type.

**Actual behavior:**
UITypeEditor does not type forward even though its a public type

**Expected behavior:**
UITypeEditor should type forward from System.Drawing.Design facade to System.Windows.Forms.Design. The type forward should be generated automatically and not have to be manually inserted in the project.

**Minimal repro:**
Fails test in PR #2230 when removing skip entry
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "UITypeEditor does not type-forward from System.Drawing.Design" (#2413)

Issues.Title: ControlBindingsConverter missing
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0 master
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
WinForms [is referencing](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=ControlBindingsConverter&unscoped_q=ControlBindingsConverter) `ControlBindingsConverter` but not providing an implementation for it.

**Actual behavior:**
The implementation of `ControlBindingsConverter` is not available

**Expected behavior:**
Either
* remove the reference via attribute and provide no replacement
* remove the reference via attribute but provide a replacement within the VS Designer environment
* port the converter to WinForms

The third option is required if the converter is supposed to be supported in 3rd party designers.

**Minimal repro:**
PR #2230 test failure when removing skip entry
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ControlBindingsConverter missing" (#2412)

Issues.Title: DesignerAttributes referencing nonexisting classes
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0 master
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
Regression in many (but not all) `DesignerAttribute` annotations, all attributes have been ported from .NET Framework but a lot of Designer classes they are referencing have not been ported. Discovered during implementation of PR #2230 which is testing the consistency of attribute annotations.

**Actual behavior:**
`[DesignerAttribute]` referencing a type which does not exist

**Expected behavior:**
One of these options needs to be chosen for each designer:
- remove the DesignerAttribute and provide no designer
- remove the DesignerAttribute in WinForms, but port the Designer within VS and add the attribute dynamically in the VS Designer environment
- port the Designer class into WinForms

Which choice to make should be primarily driven by whether you want to support that control being used in a 3rd party designer (requires option 3)

**Minimal repro:**
PR #2230 test failures when removing skipped entries

**List of classes failing the test:**

- [AxDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=AxDesigner&unscoped_q=AxDesigner)
- [AxHostDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=AxHostDesigner&unscoped_q=AxHostDesigner)
- [BindingNavigatorDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=BindingNavigatorDesigner&unscoped_q=BindingNavigatorDesigner)
- [BindingSourceDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=BindingSourceDesigner&unscoped_q=BindingSourceDesigner)
- [ButtonBaseDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=ButtonBaseDesigner&unscoped_q=ButtonBaseDesigner)
- [ComboBoxDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=ComboBoxDesigner&unscoped_q=ComboBoxDesigner)
- [DataGridViewColumnDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=DataGridViewColumnDesigner&unscoped_q=DataGridViewColumnDesigner)
- [DataGridViewComboBoxColumnDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=DataGridViewComboBoxColumnDesigner&unscoped_q=DataGridViewComboBoxColumnDesigner)
- [DataGridViewDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=DataGridViewDesigner&unscoped_q=DataGridViewDesigner)
- [DateTimePickerDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=DateTimePickerDesigner&unscoped_q=DateTimePickerDesigner)

- [FolderBrowserDialogDesigner](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=FolderBrowserDialogDesigner&unscoped_q=FolderBrowserDialogDesigner)

Issues.Title: Narrator does not announce Up/Down buttons when targeting .NET Core 5.0
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (.NET Core SDK 5.0.100 – alpha1 – 5.0.100.15753)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
In .Net Core 5.0 apps Narrator doesn't announce Up/Down buttons if a user uses CapsLock + kreyboard arrows combination. It works well in .Net 4.8 & .Net Core 3.1.

**More Info:**
This is a regression issue, it cannot reproduce in .Net Core 3.1.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Narrator does not announce Up/Down buttons.
![Actual(targeting5 0)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18568603/69301072-fd4f3e00-0c4f-11ea-8c63-af9eeaebc462.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
Narrator should announce Up/Down buttons.
![Expected(targeting3 1) gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18568603/69301078-004a2e80-0c50-11ea-8339-81571a089acd.gif)

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Download the attached .Net Core 5.0 app.
[UpDownButtons.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3872649/UpDownButtons.zip)

2.	Run it and launch the Narrator and press possible arrows combination to observe the announcement.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Narrator does not announce Up/Down buttons when targeting .NET Core 5.0" (#2406)

Issues.Title: Cleanup ValidateRect and add tests for affected components
Issues.Body:
## Proposed Changes
- Cleanup ValidateRect
- Add tests to cover affected components

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2398)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup ValidateRect and add tests for affected components" (#2398)

Issues.Title: Visual Studio becomes unresponsive when debugging DateTimePicker ValueChanged event
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
Setting a breakpoint on the **first** line of code inside the ValueChanged event handler causes Visual Studio to become unresponsive, when the breakpoint is hit.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

**Expected behavior:**

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create WinForms .Net Core app and add a DateTimePicker control to the form.
2. Add the ValueChanged event handler to the control.
3. On ValueChanged, add code to show a messagebox.
4. Place a breakpoint on the line of code.
5. Debug the app. When the breakpoint is hit, Visual Studio will become unresponsive and cannot continue.
```
private void dateTimePicker1_ValueChanged(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {            
            MessageBox.Show("hello world"); //breakpoint here             
        }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visual Studio becomes unresponsive when debugging DateTimePicker ValueChanged event" (#2393)

Issues.Title: fix: Unable to pack Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms
Issues.Body:
Closes #2395



## Proposed changes

- Copy the project's intellisense file to the ref folder as a temporary fix until the intellisense file will be added to the main docs bundle.
Without the file we were unable to pack.

- Once the intellisense file is added to the main docs bundle, the task will start breaking and remind us to revert the change.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2396)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: Unable to pack Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms" (#2396)

Issues.Title: Unable to pack Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: master
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

The dev version is not flowing through to core-sdk, isn't getting bundled, and as a result isn't available to our early adopters.
After a discussion with @AdamYoblick and @dagood it was concluded that the flow is broken because we are unable to pack, due to a missing intellisense file for Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms project.
```
C:\Development\winforms\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-alpha1-013788\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): 
error NU5019: File not found: 'C:\Development\winforms\artifacts\bin\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms\Debug\netcoreapp5.0\ref\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms.xml'. [C:\Development\winforms\pkg\Microsoft.Private.Winforms\Microsoft.Private.Winforms.csproj]

Build FAILED.
```

Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms project is a recent addition, and thus its docs haven't been ingested into the docs project.

**Expected behavior:**

` > .\build -pack` executes without errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to pack Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms" (#2395)
